item.title: Kemper add a quote by James Ellroy
item.description: "America was never innocent. We popped our cherry on the boat over and looked back with no regrets. You can't ascribe our fall from grace to any single event or set of circumstances. You can't lose what you lacked at conception." -- James Ellroy

item.title: Kemper add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "And so it goes..." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Kemper add a quote by David Simon
item.description: "My standard for verisimilitude is simple and I came to it when I started to write prose narrative: fuck the average reader. I was always told to write for the average reader in my newspaper life. The average reader, as they meant it, was some suburban white subscriber with two-point-whatever kids and three-point-whatever cars and a dog and a cat and lawn furniture. He knows nothing and he needs everything explained to him right away, so that exposition becomes this incredible, story-killing burden. Fuck him. Fuck him to hell." -- David Simon

item.title: Kemper add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The fact that we live at the bottom of a deep gravity well, on the surface of a gas covered planet going around a nuclear fireball 90 million miles away and think this to be normal is obviously some indication of how skewed our perspective tends to be." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Kemper add a quote by John Updike
item.description: "Everybody who tells you how to act has whiskey on their breath." -- John Updike

item.title: Kemper add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "When his life was ruined, his family killed, his farm destroyed, Job knelt down on the ground and yelled up to the heavens, "Why god? Why me?" and the thundering voice of God answered, There's just something about you that pisses me off." -- Stephen King

item.title: Kemper add a quote by Ben Fountain
item.description: "So perhaps, it occurs to Billy, this is the whole point of civilization, the eating of beautiful meals and the taking of decorous dumps, in which case he is for it, having had a bellyful of the other way." -- Ben Fountain

item.title: Kemper add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Kemper add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Kemper add a quote by Neal Stephenson
item.description: "Talent was not rare; the ability to survive having it was." -- Neal Stephenson

item.title: Kemper add a quote by Charles Schultz
item.description: "<b>I</b> love mankind ... it's <b>people</b> I can't stand!!" -- Charles Schultz

item.title: Kemper add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "Remember to always be yourself. Unless you suck." -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Kemper add a quote by David Milch
item.description: "Pain or damage don't end the world. Or despair, or fucking beatings. The world ends when you're dead. Until then, you've got more punishment in store. Stand it like a man... and give some back." -- David Milch

item.title: Kemper add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "What fresh hell is this?" -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Kemper add a quote by Richard Ford
item.description: "What's friendship's realest measure? I'll tell you. The amount of precious time you'll squander on someone else's calamities and fuck-ups." -- Richard Ford

item.title: Kemper add a quote by Douglas Coupland
item.description: "TV and the Internet are good because they keep stupid people from spending too much time out in public." -- Douglas Coupland

item.title: Kemper add a quote by James Ellroy
item.description: "I am the son of a murdered woman—anybody who'd call my books misogynistic is, frankly, out of their fucking mind. " -- James Ellroy

item.title: Kemper add a quote by Joe R. Lansdale
item.description:
"You need to read some Agatha Christie, man.
Why? Am I being punished?" -- Joe R. Lansdale

item.title: Kemper add a quote by Joe R. Lansdale
item.description: "Let me tell you, if you have never seen an agitated squirrel you have seen very little, nor have you heard much, because the sound of an angry squirrel is not to be forgotten." -- Joe R. Lansdale

item.title: Kemper add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "I’ve been drunk for about a week now, and I thought it might sober me up to sit in a library." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Kemper add a quote by Jonathan Franzen
item.description: "The personality susceptible to the dream of limitless freedom is a personality also prone, should the dream ever sour, to misanthropy and rage." -- Jonathan Franzen

item.title: Kemper add a quote by Robert Penn Warren
item.description: "Just tell 'em you're gonna soak the fat boys and forget the rest of the tax stuff...Willie, make 'em cry, make 'em laugh, make 'em mad, even mad at you. Stir them up and they'll love it and come back for more, but, for heaven's sakes, don't try to improve their minds." -- Robert Penn Warren

item.title: Kemper add a quote by Jonathan Franzen
item.description: "Integrity's a neutral value. Hyenas have integrity, too. They're pure hyena." -- Jonathan Franzen

item.title: Kemper add a quote by Larry McMurtry
item.description: "Anyway, whacking a surly bartender ain't much of a crime." -- Larry McMurtry

item.title: Kemper add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "True heroism is minutes, hours, weeks, year upon year of the quiet, precise, judicious exercise of probity and care—with no one there to see or cheer. This is the world." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Kemper add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "To be, in a word, unborable.... It is the key to modern life. If you are immune to boredom, there is literally nothing you cannot accomplish" -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Kemper add a quote by Chad Harbach
item.description: "You told me once that a soul isn't something a person is born with but something that must be built, by effort and error, study and love. And you did that with more dedication than most, that work of building a soul-not for your own benefit but for the benefit of those that knew you." -- Chad Harbach

item.title: Kemper add a quote by Tina Fey
item.description: "Politics and prostitution have to be the only jobs where inexperience is considered a virtue. In what other profession would you brag about not knowing stuff? “I’m not one of those fancy Harvard heart surgeons. I’m just an unlicensed plumber with a dream and I’d like to cut your chest open.” The crowd cheers." -- Tina Fey

item.title: Kemper add a quote by Don Winslow
item.description: "Smart people sometimes get stupid, but stupid people never get smart." -- Don Winslow

item.title: Kemper add a quote by Donald Ray Pollock
item.description: "I don't know,' Del said. 'I read this book. I guess you could say we were looking for a better life.' 'Did you find it?' the Fish Stick Girl asked. 'No, it was just a goddamn book. I ain't read one since." -- Donald Ray Pollock
